intro: Calamistrum mandonii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate and heart-shaped, with a rough texture adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Calamistrum mandonii is often found growing on rocky slopes and in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh desert conditions.
